speaker: Archive of Names
lines: Stone tablets stacked like chorus risers hold the cityâ€™s many voices.
Each name hums at a pitch that fits the person who wore it.
Some were sung out. Some were said once and put away tenderly.
A scribe's skeleton sits with quill raised; ink still argues in the well.
On the far wall a single blank tablet waits like a mouth closed politely.
The room tastes of salt and broom; good work lasted here.
A thread ties three tablets: a king, a gate, a debt.
You could add a name, or erase a debt, or learn how to do neither.
Your hand itches to weigh something.

choices.text: Add your name to the archive.
Erase the king's debt with the gate.
Close the ink and leave as you found it.
